revision.text: {{Talk header|search=yes}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=02:26, 23 April 2011 |action1link=Talk:1689 Boston revolt/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=425386651 |action2=PR |action2date=17:24, 9 September 2011 |action2link=Wikipedia:Peer review/1689 Boston revolt/archive1 |action2result=reviewed |action2oldid=449199503 |action3=WAR |action3date=05:06, 9 October 2011 |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/1689 Boston revolt |action3result=not approved |action3oldid=454623091 |action4=FAC |action4date=03:11, 12 December 2011 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/1689 Boston revolt/archive1 |action4result=promoted |action4oldid=465178887 |dykdate=11 September 2010 |dykentry=... that [[Puritan]] Bostonians overthrew their governor, loyal to the Catholic [[James II of England]], during the '''[[1689 Boston revolt]]'''? |topic=history |currentstatus=FA |maindate=December 26, 2011 |four=no }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA |A-Class= fail |B1 =yes |B2 =yes |B3 =yes |B4 =yes |B5 =yes |British=yes|US=yes|Early-Modern=yes}} {{WikiProject England|class=FA|importance=Low}} {{WikiProject United States|class=FA|importance=Low|MA=yes|MA-importance=Low|Boston=yes|Boston-importance=Low|USMIL=yes}} }} {{On this day|date1=2012-04-18|oldid1=487887885|date2=2013-04-18|oldid2=550895649|date3=2014-04-18|oldid3=604732433|date4=2016-04-18|oldid4=715660737}} == A-class review == Upon completion of the Peer Review process, and subsequent changes and revisions, would it be possible to advance this article to an A-class review? [[User:DCI2026|''DCI'']][[User talk:DCI2026|2026]] 17:28, 10 September 2011 (UTC) {{seealso|Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/1689 Boston revolt}} == Importance Assessment == If another person or Coordinator feels it should be higher than "Low", please feel free to change it to another "Importance Assessment". [[User:Adamdaley|Adamdaley]] ([[User talk:Adamdaley|talk]]) 22:59, 30 September 2011 (UTC) ==Dissolution of the dominion== When did some of this stuff happen? This section could be improved by explicit dating.[[User:Alanscottwalker|Alanscottwalker]] ([[User talk:Alanscottwalker|talk]]) 18:27, 19 October 2011 (UTC) :Most of these decisions happened within the month following the revolt. [[Dominion of New England]] has some of the dates on which key decisions were made, but it was not always an immediate (one-day) process. I don't think precision is particularly needed here, but a better description of how closely the events followed the revolt might be helpful. ''[[User:Magicpiano|Magic]]''[[User_talk:Magicpiano|â™ªpiano]] 22:06, 19 October 2011 (UTC) == At what point was Edmund Andros arrested by Lt. Col. Jonas Bond == This shows up in some of the historian accounts and is not in this article. I would like to see a sentence added for obvious reasons but do not know where to put it. I have seen in sme of the historian accounts that Edmund Andros was arrested at a pivotal moment by Massachusetts Militia Lieutenant Colonel Jonas Bond. This is of interest to me for obvious reasons but I do not know where to put it.[[User:RichardBond|RichardBond]] ([[User talk:RichardBond|talk]]) 23:11, 17 November 2012 (UTC)
